page.title: 03Birds at Blackmoorfoot
page.content: {Blackmoorfoot}is well known locally for its ornithological interest.It was opened to the public in 1978 and this created a lot of disturbance.In 1982 an agreement was made,however,between the{Water Authority}and{The {Huddersfield Bird Club}, giving them exclusive use of the west bank. {Birdwatching}has increased from around 100 days a year in the late 1950s to over 300 days by the l970s.Many rare birds have been found including a{Buff {Breasted Sandpiper}(from the USA) and a{Pallas's Warbler}from Siberia.It is important as a gull roost in the winter (up to 5000 birds) and is a bird ringing site.Local populations of birds being studied as well as passage migrants.A{Chaffinch}ringed at the reservoir was recovered in Norway 3 years later and 978 kms. away.
